Articles.Content:
Leonard Nimoy has passed away at the age of 83.

Short article here: [http://comicbook.com/2015/02/27/star-treks-leonard-nimoy-passes-at-83/](http://comicbook.com/2015/02/27/star-treks-leonard-nimoy-passes-at-83/)

EDIT: better article here: [https://tv.yahoo.com/blogs/tv-news/leonard-nimoy-dies-at-83-171803235.html](https://tv.yahoo.com/blogs/tv-news/leonard-nimoy-dies-at-83-171803235.html)

May he rest in peace.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-27T17:52:48Z" title="02/27/2015 05:52  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 27, 2015</time> by r4pt0r**

Ok...NOW I am REALLY sad!

(first I find out I'm gonna be moving out of the house I lived in for 21 years, and now THIS!)
That's a genuine pity. Probably one of sci-fi's most beloved actors.
Good thing Sheldon got that napkin from Penny for Saturnalia.
Where's a Genesis planet when you need one ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

Some tweets about him:

Nathan Fillion: "I have been, and always shall be, your fan."

Jonathan Frakes: "RIP to the best First Officer."

Chris Hadfield: "Leonard, you lived long and prospered, and were an inspiration to me and to millions. Rest in peace."

Wil Wheaton: "We stood on your shoulders, and wouldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have had a galaxy to explore if you hadnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t been there, first. Thank you, Leonard, Rest in peace."

And his own last tweet, somewhat haunting: "A life is like a garden. Perfect moments can be had, but not preserved, except in memory."

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-27T19:31:54Z" title="02/27/2015 07:31  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 27, 2015</time> by Red Iron Crown**
The world is a little worse off today, but it's a much better world for having had Leonard Nimoy in it.
rest in peace, may your soul find its place among the stars.

You will be missed... I still watch something Star Trek every week or so... This will make me watch it all over again. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Edit: Just noticed someone posted this 3 mins ago.. in the proper place on the forums... sorry for breaking the rules!
I just got the news 10 minutes ago from CNN on my iPad... Sad day indeed. \*bows head and does the Vulcan salute\*
RIP-Spock
We all know these things will happen eventually, but it doesn't make it any easier.
A sad day for all Star Trek fans, RIP Leonard.
Live long and prosper wherever you are now Mr. Spock. Very sad day for all SF fans.
[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vtQUePN5y40](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vtQUePN5y40)

I was so heartbroken when I heard he had passed... May he rest in peace. He will never be forgotten.

![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

> 
> <iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/9_8nY_LQL3w?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Don't make me cry again. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

RIP Leonard Nimoy.

I met him once

He will be remembered,today the Enterprise feels empty

RIP Leonard Nimoy

> 
> I met him once
> ...

You met him? You actually changed words with him? Then I envy you.

If you just saw him on stage at some convention I am not impressed.

But to quote [Natan Filion's tweet](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111924-Leonard-Nimoy-has-passed-away?p=1762428&viewfull=1#post1762428): "I have been, and always shall be, your fan."

End of an era. Very sad. Didn't realize he was *that* sick... terrible way to go. He was an amazing person, and he genuinely enjoyed and appreciated his role as Spock (unlike Bill Shatner) - the love and adoration it brought him by his many fans. RIP. Godspeed.
as someone who was raised on scifi, especially Star Trek, i feel a part of my childhood has just died. I am certain he will be missed and my condolences go to his family
Farewell Spock. I hope some of your ashes join Scotty's where they belong: in space

His [last Twitter entry](https://twitter.com/TheRealNimoy/status/569762773204217857) ever is so fitting: 

> 
> A life is like a garden. Perfect moments can be had, but not preserved, except in memory. LLAP [ Live Long And Prosper ]

I propose to HarvesteR and the team to include an easter egg memorial somewhere on Laythe, like they did for Armstrong...

How about a photon torpedo casing like in Star Trek III: The Search for Spock?

![twok1248_zps5a7a9a6a.jpg](http://i434.photobucket.com/albums/qq62/madmatthias/twok1248_zps5a7a9a6a.jpg)

The TOS cast is growing thinner by the year:

RIP:

Gene Roddenberry 1991 (70)

DeForest Kelley 1999 (79)

James Doohan 2005 (85)

Majel Barrett 2008 (76)

Leonard Nimoy 2015 (83)

Still alive:

William Shatner

Nichelle Nichols

George Takei

Walter Koenig

* * *

> 
> ...
> I propose to HarvesteR and the team to include an easter egg memorial somewhere on Laythe, like they did for Armstrong...
> 
> How about a photon torpedo casing like in Star Trek III: The Search for Spock?
> 
> [http://i434.photobucket.com/albums/qq62/madmatthias/twok1248_zps5a7a9a6a.jpg](http://i434.photobucket.com/albums/qq62/madmatthias/twok1248_zps5a7a9a6a.jpg)

I second this proposal.

The only Spock. 

And a fine actor in Yiddish theater, too, (which, I know he'd also liked to be remembered as)

Makes me wonder if my avatar pic seems ... inappropriate ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif).
